alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 8:08AM CST until March 03 at 12:51PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Marengo, Sumter and Hale Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 68.0 feet, Flooding of lowlands in the area occurs and cattle should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 69.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Tuesday was 69.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 51.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 68.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
